trans-unit.source: This document will walk through a deployment that uses a static public IP address allocated to a virtual machine (VM).
trans-unit.target: This document will walk through a deployment that uses a static public IP address allocated to a virtual machine (VM).

trans-unit.source: In this scenario, you have a single VM with its own static public IP address.
trans-unit.target: In this scenario, you have a single VM with its own static public IP address.

trans-unit.source: The VM is part of a subnet named **FrontEnd** and also has a static private IP address (**192.168.1.101**) in that subnet.
trans-unit.target: The VM is part of a subnet named **FrontEnd** and also has a static private IP address (**192.168.1.101**) in that subnet.

trans-unit.source: You may need a static IP address for web servers that require SSL connections in which the SSL certificate is linked to an IP address.
trans-unit.target: You may need a static IP address for web servers that require SSL connections in which the SSL certificate is linked to an IP address.

trans-unit.source: You can follow the steps below to deploy the environment shown in the figure above.
trans-unit.target: You can follow the steps below to deploy the environment shown in the figure above.
